title: 16 Mango Sale Finds That Give Kate Middleton Vibes
text: One of the fun parts of covering royal fashion is spotting a ready-to-wear item and thinking, "That would look great on Kate!" Shopping is a big part of my para-social relationship with England's future queen, and this month's end-of-season sales are a treasure trove of Middleton-approved pieces. So, I dove into the deep end and paged through thousands of items currently marked down (up to 70% off!) at Mango.The key to amassing a royal-worthy wardrobe? Excellent outerwear. Whether it's a timeless yet on-trend barn jacket, classic camel coat, or brightly colored cinched-waist topcoat worn over a coordinated dress, the outer layer is a critical component to any working royal's outfit.Keep scrolling to browse 16 super on-sale finds from Mango that would be at home in Kate Middleton's royal wardrobe. There are several blouses, sweaters, and midi-skirts in neutral and primary colors that can be mixed and matched with heels and boots.And, of course, plenty of pretty jackets to put on top!(Image credit: Getty Images) MANGO Virgin Wool Midi-Coat You're never fully dressed without a camel colored wool coat. MANGO Floral Chiffon Dress Florals are one of Kate's favorite motifs. MANGO Lyocell Skirt With Bow A subtle bow levels up this lady-like skirt. MANGO Parka With Contrasting Collar and Pockets Queen of the barn jacket? We'll take it. (Image credit: Getty Images) MANGO Straight-Fit Suit Jacket A nude kitten heel never goes out of style. MANGO Turtleneck Ruffled Blouse Ruffles look playful but refined. MANGO Turtleneck Knitted Sweater Cozy and bright—Kate has been favoring colorful turtleneck sweaters this season. MANGO Cotton Shirt With Flared Sleeves Even royals need wardrobe basics. MANGO Knitted Buttoned Jacket It's giving nautical and nice. MANGO 100% Cashmere Sweater Kate has a cashmere sweater in every primary color. MANGO Structured Double Fabric Coat With Belt A belted coat is definitely in the royal repetoir. MANGO Check Skirt With Double Belt Tartan and plaid pieces always make the cut. A midi-skirt for a Middleton seems apt, no? MANGO Leather Boots With Tall Leg Black boots look great with midi skirts. MANGO Blouse With Puffed Sleeves and Bow The bigger the bow on the blouse, the better. Drew Elovitz is originally from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, but has spent the last decade living and working in New York City. She earned a master's degree in media and popular culture from New York University, then began her career on the internet as the Twitter voice of Barbie. She worked previously at Who What Wear as the director of content strategy and also spent several years leading the social media teams at Teen Vogue and Entertainment Weekly. You'll find her byline on the site around topics such as celebrity fashion, must-have basics, beauty favorites (particularly nail polish), and wellness tips and tricks. Her personal style tends to favor the classics: She loves crisp white button-downs, sneakers, and skinny jeans—and no look is complete without a great pair of oversize sunglasses and a trusty leather jacket. After she finishes reading the entire internet every day, she can be found dining out at her favorite restaurants, trying new beauty treatments, or indulging her historical-fiction habit.
html:
One of the fun parts of covering royal fashion is spotting a ready-to-wear item and thinking, "That would look great on Kate!" Shopping is a big part of my para-social relationship with England's future queen, and this month's end-of-season sales are a treasure trove of Middleton-approved pieces. So, I dove into the deep end and paged through thousands of items currently marked down (up to 70% off!) at Mango.

The key to amassing a royal-worthy wardrobe? Excellent outerwear. Whether it's a timeless yet on-trend barn jacket, classic camel coat, or brightly colored cinched-waist topcoat worn over a coordinated dress, the outer layer is a critical component to any working royal's outfit.

Keep scrolling to browse 16 super on-sale finds from Mango that would be at home in Kate Middleton's royal wardrobe. There are several blouses, sweaters, and midi-skirts in neutral and primary colors that can be mixed and matched with heels and boots.

And, of course, plenty of pretty jackets to put on top!

MANGO

Virgin Wool Midi-Coat

You're never fully dressed without a camel colored wool coat.

MANGO

Floral Chiffon Dress

Florals are one of Kate's favorite motifs.

MANGO

Lyocell Skirt With Bow

A subtle bow levels up this lady-like skirt.

MANGO

Parka With Contrasting Collar and Pockets

Queen of the barn jacket? We'll take it.

MANGO

Straight-Fit Suit Jacket

A nude kitten heel never goes out of style.

MANGO

Turtleneck Ruffled Blouse

Ruffles look playful but refined.

MANGO

Cozy and bright—Kate has been favoring colorful turtleneck sweaters this season.

It's giving nautical and nice.

Tartan and plaid pieces always make the cut.

A midi-skirt for a Middleton seems apt, no?

MANGO

Leather Boots With Tall Leg

Black boots look great with midi skirts.

MANGO

Blouse With Puffed Sleeves and Bow

The bigger the bow on the blouse, the better.

Drew Elovitz is originally from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, but has spent the last decade living and working in New York City. She earned a master's degree in media and popular culture from New York University, then began her career on the internet as the Twitter voice of Barbie. She worked previously at Who What Wear as the director of content strategy and also spent several years leading the social media teams at Teen Vogue and Entertainment Weekly. You'll find her byline on the site around topics such as celebrity fashion, must-have basics, beauty favorites (particularly nail polish), and wellness tips and tricks. Her personal style tends to favor the classics: She loves crisp white button-downs, sneakers, and skinny jeans—and no look is complete without a great pair of oversize sunglasses and a trusty leather jacket. After she finishes reading the entire internet every day, she can be found dining out at her favorite restaurants, trying new beauty treatments, or indulging her historical-fiction habit.
